name: Andromeda Connections 2.0-3rd/4th @ ChiLo Grudge Match
description:
I've been playing and tweaking this deck for quite a long time and it has proven quite successful. My most recent success was tieing for 3rd/4th with it and my Weyland Tag N' Bag deck at the 36 person ChiLo City Grudge Match in Louisville, KY.

It's not too complicated to play. It has extreme economy with all of it's hefty resources as well as run based economy. Hostage has four targets, three of which are economy boosts and if out early, can have you set for the rest of the game. The singleton Decoy is for when you really need that early Scorch protection and either Plascrete isn't available or the Power Shutdown/Accelerated Diagnostics deck being used. You'll notice, there are not any Account Siphons. I tend to shy away from the cards everyone else uses, but since this was heavily resourced based, I did not want to deal with tags constantly. But recently, after reevaluating the deck and that card, I think I can at least get a couple in without harming this build.

name: Knighthood Gabe
Heimdall Weyland Tag N' Bag-3rd/4th @ ChiLo Grudge Match
description:
This Corp got me to the top 4 at the ChiLo City Grudge Match in Louisville,KY, along side my Andromeda Connections deck. Pretty straight forward Tag N' Bag deck. Lot's of one pointers to fuel the 3xArchers. The deck can actually win by agendas as often as it can Scorch.

The major surprise this deck offers is the singleton Heimdall 2.0. By itself, it's a pretty strong run-stopping ICE. But, when timed right, you can give the runner two Brain Damage, and your ability to Scorch them just got a lot easier.

name: Cloudcap Games True Colors Netrunner Tournament - Jan 19th
description: Winning Corporation deck from Cloudcap Games, Jan 19th. Finished with 4 wins, 0 losses as corp side.

name: Cloudcap Games True Colors Netrunner Tournament - Jan 19th -
description: Deck had 3 wins, and 1 loss as runner.

name: Mindtricks
description:
Heavy asset deck to boost economy and trick opponent into an ambush. Identity card could lead to board/hand advantage, not always unfortunately Mini ICEs tricks with Inazuma and ZED with sunset for late setup, Tyr's hand for ultimate cheese preventing brain damage subroutine to be broken and let the opponent access your ambush.

Fun and tricky to play, but need some extra refinement.

name: TWIY*
Knightman!
description:
Atman/parasite recursion suite. Burst econ paired with ProCon. Knight as a supporting breaker that will get you into a central no matter what, making it harder for the corp to lock you out of sucker counters, and encouraging the corp to trash ice when used early, which synergizes well with parasite.

Its bustin' skulls. Try it out!

name: Complete Destruction
description:
I decided not to include scorched earth because deckspace was tight and I most of the time everyone prepares for it anyways. The basic idea of this deck is to score some points at the beginning, lure them into a troubleshooted Archer, and then finish getting enough points to win.

I get tons of bad pub playing this, so IRS is there to help with that problem and can also combo well with chum. I tend to have lots of money, so Janus is there to surprise them and make a server very hard to get past. I still have punitive counterstrike so I can recover from horrible hands by putting lots of points into archives turn one, and later either killing them or Jacksoning them back into R&D.

I chose the ice to force the runner to get out all of their icebreakers, and the sentries to make mimic and ninja both have counters. Power Shutdown is amazing, even when you have to lose some AP because of it. I trashed a Garotte at the beginning of one game and won because of that, so I probably won't be taking that out.

name: Oppenheimer
description: My blind run at Tag & Bag. Fairly standard build of Event based economy. Didn't ultimately save room for Jackson Howard or Power Shutdown. Didn't want to run the latter without the former, but wasn't sure what to drop.

name: Step 3.0: PROFIT
description:
Core Concepts: All the breakers are "remainder of the run" for Strength pump so they can be boosted in step 2.3 before you lose credits in step 3.0. The Helpful AI for link, an additional STR pump, and Aesop food.

Spend money on Personal Workshop in Step 2.3 to avoid step 3.0 wastage.

Cloak and Cyberfeeder for credits you can't lose.

3x Inti for early game Barriers, feed to Aesop once you're ready to upgrade to Battering Ram. Inti can get through anything up to Wall of Static well enough.

Armitage, Personal Workshop, feed to Aesop.

Infiltration to find the payday Ice and and Emergency Shutdown/Crescentus to reset it for another payout.

Easy Mark, Armitage, and Infiltration for gaining money when you're low on credits; I expect this will happen a lot as I'll be spending my Ice-rez credits on subroutine breaking, leaving me with pocket change after a run.

name: Pure Scumbag Tactics
Andromeda's Master Key
description: Looking for feedback. Keyhole as much as you can then use the free run on archives to go get agendas

name: Weyland 7 Agendas
description:
The Runner really has to dig deep for Agendas in R&D here. Early R&D & HQ protection with enigmas, ice wall & draco. Insane Economy for big Ice, no hurry to score agendas quickly.

If the runner gets impatient you can kill him with SEA & Scorched & Power Grid Overload.

I'd love to fit in Snares somehow, but no idea what to cut....

name: Kate's Contacts
description: This deck is built around Underworld Contacts. It aims to get a powerful rig set up and then with the recurring credits and the money every turn from underworld contact to make a run every turn, with R&D lock becoming possible through the R&D interfaces. It hasn't been doing super well recently, so I posted this to get some feedback. (the point of the deck should stay the same, but any other suggestions are very welcome!)

name: Strive for perfection v.1
description: FIrst try to make my Runner deck, here are cards what I realy like and want to include, and maybe there is some other what I dont know even and would be nice to include to this. We need to cut 7 cards and maybe add somethings and again cut. I hope someone help me to improve it.

name: Andromeda's Master Key 1.1
description: Fixed the huge memory problem

name: The Blue Queen's Key
KnatMan
description:
This is a datasucker/atman deck updated with some new cards and new ideas. Knight will help breach those tough centrals. Net Shield finds a spot to help stymie the influx of Jinteki decks I've seen lately. E3 Feedback Implants helps against bioroid ICE and supplements Knight. I tossed in an HQ interface to help against Cerebral Imaging decks.

You want to see Professional Contacts early, along with an SMC or Test Run. Akametsu is important later on. Deus and Sharpshooter are great insurance.

name: Gabe New
description:
Seeing a lot of the criminal keyhole builds, I decided to try it out myself, and this is an opportunity to expand my desire to have a new, viable Gabe.

Basically siphon recursion with hopefully an early crypsis to get the show rolling. Theres a good amount of card draw, Mr. Li is great if you don't have to go tag me. Essentially start off with 1 type of pressure, and as the corp responds, shift to the next. If they double Ice HQ, then start with sneakdoor, or Keyhole, as they adjust and you keep them poor, then shift to sneakdoor/HQ. You should be able to keep up the pressure on the centrals to keep remotes less relevant.

Thinking quality time might be better depending on how the money flows, frees up an influence for a stimhack or something strong.

name: Exile's Parasucker v1.0
description:
Recurring programs is Exile's forte; recurring Parasites to repeatedly smash down a single server's defences seems like a sound concept. In practice this played out a little better on paper than IRL.

For a more detailed discussion, see my blog post here: http://daman-asha.livejournal.com/30610.html

name: Professional Attack β v0.4
description: Focus on HQ or R&D if HQ is heavily guarded.

name: Professional Scumbag v1.0
GRNDL throws money on your corpse
description: Just playing around with the idea of a GRNDL deck, lots of cash and lots of tags. This deck actually might work better with the original Weyland ID on second thought.

name: Clicks & Credits
description:
My first deck, with just the Core set and Command & Control, as those are the only cards I have.

Built around generating as many clicks as possible, and using them to get a preposterous amount of credits and advance agendas/assets as quickly as possible.

Might want to use HB's Core Set identity, instead of NEXT Design, but I like the idea of starting the game out with ICE already installed.

Feedback welcome!

name: Gabe 'Idon'thaveanameforthisdeck' Santiago
description:
...Yeah.

I think I'm better at making corp decks than runner decks.

name: Kitman Parasite v2 - 4th Place Berkeley Store Championship
Smooth Criminal
description:
first Andromeda deck ... v0.1 Too many Events? Not enough Resources? Try to splash more influence? I had 2x R&D Interface but then changed it to HQ Interface.

Thoughts and comments welcomed.

name: Reina - Skeleton Key
Mono U Aggro?!?
Captain Planet
Grift Reina v1
